verbose_text: To directly explore functional effects of metformin on Oct4 expression, iPS cells maintained in an undifferentiated stage on matrigel coated dishes in the presence of leukaemia inhibitory factor (LIF) were exogenously supplemented with 1 mmol/L metformin for 48 h. Immunofluorescence analysis using confocal microscopy revealed that metformin exposure results in drastically decreased levels of the Oct4 protein compared to vehicle treated iPS cells (XREF_FIG, left).
